bill_title: to revise the terms of service for members of the Commission on Judicial Qualifications.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the terms of service for members of the Commission on Judicial Qualifications. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-1A-2 be amended to read as follows: 16-1A-2. There is hereby created a Commission on Judicial Qualifications which shall consist of seven members as follows : (1) Two judges of the circuit court, elected by the judicial conference; (2) Three members of the bar practicing law in this state, no more than two of whom shall may be of the same political party , appointed by the president of the state bar; and (3) Two citizens who are not judges, retired judges or members of the state bar, and not of the same political party, appointed by the Governor. The term of office for a commission member is four years. No person shall may serve more than one term two consecutive terms as a member of the commission. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the terms of service for members of the Commission on Judicial Qualifications. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-1A-2 be amended to read as follows: 16-1A-2. There is hereby created a Commission on Judicial Qualifications which shall consist of seven members as follows : (1) Two judges of the circuit court, elected by the judicial conference; (2) Three members of the bar practicing law in this state, no more than two of whom shall may be of the same political party , appointed by the president of the state bar; and (3) Two citizens who are not judges, retired judges or members of the state bar, and not of the same political party, appointed by the Governor. The term of office for a commission member is four years. No person shall may serve more than one term two terms as a member of the commission. BILL HISTORY January 16 - First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 47 January 22 - Scheduled for hearing. January 22 - Passed as amended, PASSED, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 88
